articles.title: console.delight
articles.description: You use console.log to output text, but did you know that in the browser console it can be used to render other things, like SVGs and HTML? This post is packed with examples and goes deeper into the creative options opened up by the technique than you’ll probably ever need 😅
articles.author: Zach Saucier

articles.title: The AHA Stack: Another Way to Build Modern Webapps
articles.description: The AHA Stack is a full-stack webapp approach that brings together Astro, htmx, and Alpine.js, and where you send HTML over the wire. This is a fantastic showcase site that sells the idea well, complete with explanations and examples.
articles.author: Flavio Copes

articles.title: React Libraries for 2024
articles.description: The latest update of a popular, opinionated, annual guide to libraries and tools suitable for various tasks when building React apps, covering areas like state management, UI libraries, authentication, and testing.
articles.author: Robin Wieruch

articles.title: The Golden Rule of Assertions
articles.description: Artem shares a tip that helps him write better tests or, as he calls it, the ‘Golden Rule of Assertions’: “A test must fail if, and only if, the intention behind the system is not met.”
articles.author: Artem Zakharchenko

articles.title: ▶  Let's Code Minesweeper in JavaScript
articles.description: Ania is back with another of her fantastic step-by-step walkthrough videos. Now you can actually implement Minesweeper, rather than waste time playing it.. 😁
articles.author: Ania Kubów

articles.title: 5 CSS Snippets Every Frontend Developer Should Know in 2024
articles.description: Adam did a similar roundup last year, now he’s back with more toolbelt-worthy, powerful, CSS tips worth knowing.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: Migrating from Zod to Valibot: A Comparative Experience
articles.description: Zod and Valibot both provide a mechanism to validate data using types, and Matthew looks at how he found Valibot better for validating his contact form.
articles.author: Matthew Kwong

articles.title: A Difference Between getElementByID and querySelector
articles.description: IDs with leading digits pose problems when it comes to CSS selectors.
articles.author: Kiru from Switzerland

articles.title: Heat.js: A Heat Map Visualization Library
articles.description: It has no dependencies, and is small, responsive, and themeable. GitHub repo.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.title: Some Top Frontend Tools of 2023
articles.description: Louis walks through a collection of tools that he found useful in the past year. It's a rather eclectic selection – I certainly hadn't heard of many of them –  and you're sure to find some that could help in your day-to-day work.
articles.author: Louis Lazaris

articles.title: Tinybench: A Tiny, Simple Benchmarking Library
articles.description: No dependencies – it uses whatever timing capabilities are available (e.g. process.hrtime or peformance.now). You can then benchmark whatever functions you want, specify how long/how many times to benchmark, and get a variety of stats back.
articles.author: Tinylibs

articles.title: 🛰  Orbital Object Toolkit: Orbital Mechanics Made Easier
articles.description: This is miles above my paygrade (about 100 miles in fact) but if determining the positions of satellites and terms like ‘SGP4 propagation’ and ‘TLE parsing’ make sense to you..
articles.author: Theodore Kruczek

articles.title: worker-timers: setInterval/setTimeout for Unfocused Windows
articles.description: When a tab loses focus, any timers used within can be throttled. A workaround is to use a Web Worker.
articles.author: Christoph Guttandin

articles.title: Sutra.js: A Behavior Tree Library for Managing Behavior Patterns
articles.description: Primarily targeting game development use cases, Sutra lets you define and model complex behavior patterns in code.
articles.author: Yantra

articles.description: htmx has just become 0 clause BSD-licensed. It was 2 clause BSD before – the main change being attribution is no longer required on redistribution.
Yagiz Nizipli ▶️ went on the Syntax․fm podcast to talk about all things JS performance related.
A showcase of what PWAs can do today.
A look at how to compile a standalone executable using modern JavaScript runtimes.
Prettier 3.2 – The popular code formatter gains support for JSONC and Angular ICU expressions.
Knip 4.0 – Find and remove unused files and dependencies.
ReScript 11.0 – OCaml-inspired, typed 'compile to JS' language.
Node.js v21.6.0 (Current)
Node.js v20.11.0 (LTS) – Now with import.meta.dirname and import.meta.filename

articles.title: Designing Better Target Sizes
articles.description: A thoughtfully designed, interactive guide that really zeroes in on how best to design target sizes on the web. They are often far too small, particularly on mobile, so this excellent primer should set you up for getting things right.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: 5 CSS Snippets Every Frontend Developer Should Know in 2024
articles.description: Adam did this last year, and it proved very popular, so he’s back with more toolbelt worthy, powerful, CSS tips that you need to know (including nesting, sub grid, container query units, etc), all of which you can use today.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: Top Frontend Tools of 2023
articles.description: An excellent collection of popular, useful frontend tools for both CSS and JavaScript developers. You'll no doubt find something here to help speed up your development workflow.
articles.author: Louis Lazaris

articles.title: Accessible Notifications with ARIA Live Regions
articles.description: A detailed, two-part series offering an extensive guide to ARIA live regions, looking at what they are, how to use them, and how not to. Part two is here.
articles.author: Sara Soueidan

articles.title: The Complex and Awesome border-image Property
articles.description: If you’ve never reached for the powerful border-image property, Temani demonstrates some different approaches for using it to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: Using data-nosnippet to Block Content from Google Search Snippets
articles.description: One for those tinkering with all things SEO here.
articles.author: Glenn Gabe

articles.title: Money Talks? Formatting Currency in Web Content
articles.description: How do screen readers announce money amounts and currency symbols in web content?
articles.author: Ricky Onsman

articles.title: ▶  'I Hate CORS'
articles.description: “Cross Origin Resource Sharing was, in many ways, a mistake. It has caused as much pain as it has solved, if not significantly more..” — This video dives into just why Theo holds that opinion. In response, Jake Archibald shared this historical context.
articles.author: Theo Browne

articles.title: 'I Used Netscape Composer in 2024'
articles.description: Just how far can you get using a WYSIWYG page editor released in the 1990s?
articles.author: Pier-Luc Brault

articles.title: What PWAs Can Do Today: A Showcase of What's Possible
articles.description: We first shared this over three years ago, but things have come along a lot since. There are some interactive demos to help show off what’s possible.
articles.author: Danny Moerkerke

articles.title: Pa11y: An Automated Accessibility Testing Tool
articles.description: Something you can add into your build process.
articles.author: Pa11y

articles.title: Heynote: A Dedicated Scratchpad for Developers
articles.description: A native, open-source app for Windows, Mac, and Linux, described as “a large persistent text buffer” that’s divided into blocks where each block allows syntax highlighting and JSON is auto-formatted.
articles.author: Jonatan Heyman

articles.title: Penrose: Beautiful Diagrams by Just Writing Plain Text
articles.description: A little bit like charting tool Mermaid but with a more mathematical focus – there are plenty of examples to get a feel for it.
articles.author: Penrose Contributors

articles.title: SVG Icons CLI: A Command Line Tool for Creating SVG Sprite Sheets
articles.description: This uses a React Component to offer a middle-ground between dropping your SVGs into HTML image elements (less flexible) vs. importing them in your JS bundle (less performant).
articles.author: Alex Anderson
